title: How Safe Is New York’s Subway? What Its Workers Have to Say.
description: From M.T.A. workers to buskers to shopkeepers, the people whose livelihood depends on the system offered a complex portrait of the subway as ridership approaches prepandemic normalcy.
dc:creator: Karen Zraick, Téa Kvetenadze and Francesca Paris
media:credit: Thalia Juarez for The New York Times
media:description: Nicolet Seymour, 34, who lives in the northeast Bronx and is approaching three years on the job cleaning the subway, says that she feels M.T.A. workers are “easy targets” for attacks.
